meanings.definition: To bless or consecrate with a sign of the cross.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest will saining the newborn baby.
meanings.sent2: The priest performed the saining ritual before the wedding ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The saining of the house involved sprinkling holy water in every room.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of peace after saining the room with the sign of the cross.
meanings.sent5: The act of saining the bread made it sacred and special for the occasion.

meanings.definition: The act of purifying or sanctifying.
meanings.sent1: The saining of the water made it suitable for drinking.
meanings.sent2: The saining of the temple was a solemn and important event.
meanings.sent3: The saining of the garden involved removing all the weeds and pests.
meanings.sent4: The saining of the soul brought a sense of inner peace and clarity.
meanings.sent5: The saining of the air with incense created a serene atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: A ceremony or ritual for protection or purification.
meanings.sent1: The saining of the house was believed to ward off evil spirits.
meanings.sent2: The annual saining of the village fountain was a community event.
meanings.sent3: The saining of the tools before the harvest ensured a bountiful yield.
meanings.sent4: The saining of the amulet provided a sense of security to the wearer.
meanings.sent5: The saining of the forest was a sacred ritual to maintain its purity and balance.
